intro: Koeleria delavignei subsp. veresczaginii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley feathergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the禾本科 (Poaceae) family, which includes grasses. This subspecies is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. The plant is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
